page.title: 09Life Styles in Halland
page.content: Halland is a small community. Many of the inhabitants have lived there for all of their long lives. There are also younger couples who have moved in recently mainly from South London in search of a quiet, picturesque environment. The daily occupations of residents falls broadly into two categories. Several have small holdings in the area on which they produce fruit and vegetables for their own use. For additional income, they supply the local nursery with their excess crops. Employment for other residents is found outside the area in larger towns such as Uckfield and Lewes. People need to leave the area to shop. The main form of transport is private vehicles although there is a bus route that passes through the village twices a day. A school bus takes the children 2 miles to school.
